text.p: Now suppose that [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{C}[/mathjaxinline] is a basis of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] with 7 vectors. Is it possible for there to be a basis [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{B}[/mathjaxinline] of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] with 5 vectors?

font.p: If [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{B}[/mathjaxinline] is a list containing 5 vectors and forms a basis for [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline], then the list [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{C}[/mathjaxinline], which contains 7 vectors, must be linearly dependent. But, by definition, a linearly dependent list cannot be a basis. This contradicts the assumption that [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{C}[/mathjaxinline] formed a basis for [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline].
